channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report X-2023090362
item.description:
Report X-2023090362

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: GRIMES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package leaked product on unloaders who moved the wet box. We quickly ascertained the product was ethanol to assure them they were not in danger of a corrosive substance. The package handlers washed hands and returned to work. DescribePack: The release was caused by a loose cap during transport. The continuous sloshing of liquid during transit caused contents to escape the container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We immediate isolated the box in a plastic-lined tote and set-aside in the hazmat cage until we could process the DPR and ISF. We used towels to wipe up the wet surface in the trailer.

item.title: Report X-2023090138
item.description:
Report X-2023090138

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: DAVENPORT
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE SPILL WEARING ALL PROPER PPE. USING DECSION TREE AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEETS, RESPONDER CONTAINED THE SPILL. ONCE CONTAINED RESPONDER BROUGHT IT TO THE DMP AREA. RESPONDER PROCESSED THE SPILL USING THE WASTE DISPOALE CHART.

item.title: Report E-2023090387
item.description:
Report E-2023090387

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the cap on one 330 gallon poly tote of scalebreak (un1760) had a loose cap that wasn't tightened prior to shipment had released 3 ounces of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023081253
item.description:
Report X-2023081253

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: driver noticed a wet package on his van during his route, he realized it was a Hazmat package so he brought it back to the station DescribePack: manager opened the package and noticed two caps were loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was immediately placed in a hazmat drum
